member.name: T:System.Collections.Generic.Deque`1
member.summary: A genetic Deque class. It can be thought of as a double-ended queue, hence Deque. This allows for an O(1) AddFront, AddBack, RemoveFront, RemoveBack. The Deque also has O(1) indexed lookup, as it is backed by a circular array.
member.typeparam: The type of objects to store in the deque.

member.name: F:System.Collections.Generic.Deque`1.defaultCapacity
member.summary: The default capacity of the deque.

member.name: F:System.Collections.Generic.Deque`1.startOffset
member.summary: The first element offset from the beginning of the data array.

member.name: F:System.Collections.Generic.Deque`1.buffer
member.summary: The circular array holding the items.

member.param: The initial capacity of the Deque.

member.name: M:System.Collections.Generic.Deque`1.CopyTo(`0[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Copies the elements of the Deque to a System.Array, starting at a particular System.Array index.
member.param: The one-dimensional System.Array that is the destination of the elements copied from the Deque. The System.Array must have zero-based indexing.
The zero-based index in array at which copying begins.
member.exception: The number of elements in the source Deque is greater than the available space from arrayIndex to the end of the destination array.
